describe: New Zealand is an island country located in the southwestern Pacific Ocean. It is known for its stunning landscapes, ranging from lush forests and mountains to beautiful beaches and fjords. The country is made up of two main landmasses, the North Island and the South Island, and numerous smaller islands. It is famous for its indigenous Maori culture, vibrant cities, and outdoor adventure opportunities.

cities.name: üèù Auckland
cities.geographical_location: Located on the North Island, Auckland is situated between two large harbors.
cities.climate: Auckland has a temperate maritime climate, with warm, humid summers and mild, damp winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Fish and chips, pavlova, and hangi.

cities.name: üèù Queenstown
cities.geographical_location: Located in the Otago region on the South Island, nestled on the shores of Lake Wakatipu.
cities.climate: Queenstown has an oceanic climate, with cold winters and warm summers.
cities.famous_cuisine: Fergburger, New Zealand lamb, and local wines.

cities.name: üèù Wellington
cities.geographical_location: Situated at the southern tip of the North Island, overlooking the Cook Strait.
cities.climate: Wellington has a temperate maritime climate, with moderate temperatures and regular wind.
cities.famous_cuisine: Craft beer, flat white coffee, and seafood.
